ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Shows how to create stacked column chart
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Generates a Stacked Column chart with multiple stacked groups to render the stacked groups side by side. The [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.StackedColumnRenderableSeries.html']StackedColumnRenderableSeries API[/url] can be used to render columns stacked one above another, side by side, or a Left or Right aligned Bar Chart.
Columns are rendered using the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseRenderableSeries~Stroke.html']Stroke[/url] (outline) and [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseColumnRenderableSeries~Fill.html']Fill[/url] (fill).
[b][i]Tips![/i][/b]
Do you need to change the width of the column? Try setting [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseColumnRenderableSeries~DataPointWidth.html']DataPointWidth[/url] from 0.0 to 1.0. This alters how much space the column takes up. Also the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseColumnRenderableSeries~UseUniformWidth.html']UseUniformWidth[/url] property may be used to define whether column widths are uniform or not
Do you need to make one of the series invisible? Try to check/uncheck checkboxes in legend, or set [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.BaseRenderableSeries~IsVisible.html']BaseRenderableSeries.IsVisible[/url] = false. There are no gaps in series, if you make them invisible.
